result.execSummary:
The defendant Tou Y Xiong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
No contact with Tremors Bar & H.L. unless authorized by agent.

SAFE assessment and follow up.
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:20 am 
INCLUDES 15CF1110, 15CM1981, AND 16CF260. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Def appears in person with Atty Jim Kurszewski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1110: Ct. 1 (Theft)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1981: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF260: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Computer Message - Threaten Injury or Harm/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM1981: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF260: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL: SAFE assessment and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; pay $4600 restitution to Tremors Bar to be paid at a rate of at least $130 per month; no contact with Tremors Bar and H.L. unless authorized by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit - parties may submit written stipulation re: jail credit at a later date. 

Adj: 9:40 am
